definition: the "good-looks club": people who attach great importance to a person's appearance (pun on 外貿協會|外贸协会 foreign trade association)
to cooperate/to harmonize/to help/to assist/to join
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
outsourcing/people who judge others by their looks (abbr. for 外貌協會|外貌协会[wai4 mao4 xie2 hui4])
"Mr Perfect" (i.e. tall, rich and handsome) (Internet slang)
Virgo (constellation and sign of the zodiac)/popular variant of 室女座[Shi4 nu:3 zuo4]
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
hard to deal with/hard to get along with
(coll.) outwardly cold or retiring but deep and passionate inside
(coll.) presenting as unfriendly and blunt, but warm and tender inside (loanword from Japanese "tsundere")
